text: Milo Barnum Richardson (February 13, 1849 - May 17, 1912) was president of the Barnum Richardson Company.Statistics of the American and foreign iron trades, Volume 1911. page 14. American Iron and Steel Association Accessed April 13, 2010 He served as a state representative and a state senator. Richardson was the son of industrialist Leonard Richardson. Milo B. Richardson served on the Connecticut Board of World's Fair Commissioners at the World's Columbian Exposition of 1893. He was also the first cousin of Ada Willard Richardson, the daughter of renowned building contractor William Douglas Richardson, and who married Illinois banker George Wallace Bunn, Sr. (See: John Whitfield Bunn and Jacob Bunn). ==References== Category:1849 births Category:1912 deaths Category:American industrialists Category:19th-century American businesspeople
